_header: O death how bitter is the mind of thee
Subjects: death, meditations on; elegies; epitaphs; Cromwell, Ralph, lord Treasurer
_description: The bitterness of Death, an elegy for the tomb of Ralph, Lord Cromwell, circa 1450 — eight 8-line stanzas (ababbaba; only two rhymes used throughout)

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
O deth how byttere ys þe mynde of theThat menere art of
                    mornyng & mone…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Vs to preserue fro all owre gostly fonAnd send vs pees yn
                    perpetuyte
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Seven stanzas. ‘Amen ffor charite’ by scribe at end (f.
                    58).
